825827.project_objective: Develop new regression-based methods for quality improvement in data-rich complex systems
825827.limitations_addressed: Existing methods have limited capabilities in handling data uncertainties
research_tasks: Process modeling, monitoring, and fault detection based on data with uncertainties
Separation of process fault and sensor fault
Optimal sensor allocation for monitoring and diagnosis
Identification of maximum allowable level of data uncertainty
expected_outcomes: Bridge gap between data uncertainty studies and quality engineering
Advance state-of-the-art in quality improvement methodologies
Guide design, selection, and allocation of sensors
825827.education_plan_integration: New curriculum development, student internship opportunities, women and minority student recruitment, K-12 programs

project_title: Development of Efficient Spectral Element Algorithms

808004.project_description: Survey of the Ensemble Physical Properties of Cometary Nuclei
808004.focus: understanding comet population in the Solar System
808004.objectives: investigate sizes, albedos, colors, shapes, rotations of comets
808004.importance: probe thermo-physical conditions of proto-planetary disk
808004.nuclei_aspects: bulk strength, mass loss, fragmentation, albedos, colors, axial ratios
808004.locations: Mauna Kea, La Silla, La Palma, Palomar
808004.educational_context: useful for upper-level undergraduate courses on astronomical techniques
808004.international_collaboration: France, Spain, United Kingdom, four U.S. states

852846.research_objective: determine response of pollination and pollen limitation of plant reproduction to increasing diversity
852846.grant_goal: conduct feasibility studies and gather preliminary data
852846.experimental_focus: mechanisms of global pollen limitation-biodiversity gradients
852846.student_development: two students as members of global scientific community
852846.outcome: better understanding of plant-pollinator interactions and biodiversity
852846.conservation_importance: effective conservation of plants and pollinators

850564.collaborating_institutions: California State University campuses, University of Kansas
program_objectives: encourage research at non-Ph.D. granting campuses

807140.intellectual_merit: New scholarship program, Scientists for Tomorrow
project_objectives: improving first-year performance among at-risk groups
involving students in the scientific community
transitioning students to other existing sources of support
affecting graduation rates, graduate school matriculation and scientific career choices
807140.selection_process: Filtered by Office of Student Financial Services based on need, selected by departmental committee using academic merit criteria
807140.broader_impact: Addresses national areas of need, supports low-income and underrepresented groups in sciences
807140.university_contribution: Major contribution to minority education, top ten in bachelor's degrees, first in doctoral degrees awarded to Hispanics
807140.existing_support_programs: Encouragement to traditionally underrepresented populations, participation in research
807140.expected_impact: Concrete impact on recruitment and retention in sciences

813186.research_locations: Australia, China, Japan, Korea, New Zealand, Singapore, Taiwan
813186.science_policy_introduction: introduction to science and science policy infrastructure
813186.cultural_orientation: orientation to the culture and language of the location
813186.program_goals: expose students to science and engineering in research laboratory
813186.future_collaborations: foster research collaborations with foreign counterparts

855326.research_objective: improve understanding and capabilities in concept generation through design by analogy methods
855326.initial_application: design of prosthetic and orthotic devices for persons with disabilities
deliverables: means to generalize design problems through functional descriptions
ability to search for analogical solutions with alternative functional representations
ways to search for geometric similarities across functional analogies
ability to produce a tractable set of analogies for designers
transformative_impacts: advancement of analogies in engineering design methods
computer implementation of the method contributing to cyber infrastructure
cross-fertilization of theory and research techniques
development of instructional materials for training students
855326.instructional_materials_availability: freely available to instructors at other institutions

847799.impact_areas: aquatic habitat, water quality, channel stability
847799.hypothesis_aspects: turbulence, grain properties, spatial variability, temporal variations
847799.intellectual_merit: understanding turbulence and sediment transport processes
847799.education_objectives: graduate classes, international research, K-12 education, Women in Science Camp
847799.project_outcomes: transform predictions of landscape evolution, river restoration design
